Data

Meningioma

This file create a temporal master table from Meningioma data. The folder meningioma/csv must contains the following csv files:

  • meningioma.outcome.time004.pathology.csv

  • meningioma.variable.time001.demographics.csv

  • meningioma.variable.time002.radiographics.csv

  • meningioma.variable.time003.therapy.csv

  • meningioma.variable.time004.pathology.csv

data.meningioma.create_master_table.main()

Main function that creates a temporal master table from Meningioma data.

Returns:

MIMIC

This file create a temporal master table from MIMIC-IV data. The folder mimic/csv must contains the following csv files:

  • admissions.csv

  • chartevents.csv

  • cxr_ic_fusion_1103.csv

  • d_items.csv

  • d_labitems.csv

  • haim_mimiciv_key_ids.csv

  • labevents.csv

  • procedureevents.csv

  • radiology.csv

data.mimic.create_master_table.filter_df_with_patient_identifiers(df, dict_patient_identifiers)

Get all data matching the patient identifiers in df.

Parameters:

  • df – Pandas dataframe.

  • dict_patient_identifiers – Dict of patient identifiers (i.e. subject_id, hadm_id, stay_id).

Returns:

Filtered dataframe.

data.mimic.create_master_table.generate_event_sr_embeddings(sr_patient_event, event)

Generate embeddings for an event given time series data.

Parameters:

  • sr_patient_event – Pandas time series concerning a certain event for a patient.

  • event – The event name (str).

Returns:

sr_embeddings: Embeddings for the series sr_patient_event.

data.mimic.create_master_table.generate_patient_event_embeddings(df_events, event_list, df_item_label, df_key_ids, dict_patient_identifiers, time_column, series_column, event_category_name, timedelta)

Generate patient embeddings for a certain event category, one row every timedelta range.

Parameters:

  • df_events – Pandas Dataframe from event type csv (chartevents, labevents or procedureevents).

  • event_list – List of event we want to filter (CHARTEVENTS, LABEVENTS, PROCEDUREEVENTS).

  • df_item_label – Pandas Dataframe from d_items or d_labitems csv.

  • df_key_ids – Pandas Dataframe from haim_mimic_key_ids.csv.

  • dict_patient_identifiers – Identifiers in the dataframe which allow to recognize a patient.

  • time_column – Column associated to time we want to consider in df_events.

  • series_column – Column associated to series values we want to consider in df_event.

  • event_category_name – Name we want to give to the event type in the master table.

  • timedelta – Range to consider getting timeseries.

Returns:

df_event_embeddings: Generated embeddings for the events in event list for the considered patient, computed at every timedelta range.

data.mimic.create_master_table.generate_patient_event_embeddings_between_dates(df_events, event_list, df_item_label, dict_patient_identifiers, time_column, series_column, event_category_name, start_date, end_date)

Generate embeddings for events for a patient between 2 dates.

Parameters:

  • df_events – Pandas Dataframe from event type csv (chartevents, labevents or procedureevents).

  • event_list – List of event we want to filter (CHARTEVENTS, LABEVENTS, PROCEDUREEVENTS).

  • df_item_label – Pandas Dataframe from d_items or d_labitems csv.

  • dict_patient_identifiers – Dict of patient identifiers (i.e. subject_id, hadm_id, stay_id).

  • time_column – Column associated to time we want to consider in df_events.

  • series_column – Column associated to series values we want to consider in df_event.

  • event_category_name – Name we want to give to the event type in the master table.

  • start_date – Date where we start looking for.

  • end_date – Date where we stop looking for.

Returns:

df_event_embeddings: Generated embeddings for the events in event_list between start_date and end_date.

data.mimic.create_master_table.generate_patient_notes_embeddings(df_notes, df_admissions, df_key_ids, patient_id, timedelta)

Generate notes embeddings for a patient every timedelta range.

Parameters:

  • df_notes – Pandas Dataframe of notes (radiology.csv).

  • df_admissions – Pandas Dataframe from admissions.csv.

  • df_key_ids – Pandas Dataframe from haim_mimic_key_ids.csv.

  • patient_id – hadm_id of a patient.

  • timedelta – Time range for embeddings generation.

Returns:

df_notes_embeddings: Pandas Dataframe of notes embeddings for the considered patient, every timedelta range

data.mimic.create_master_table.generate_patient_notes_embeddings_between_dates(df_notes, df_admissions, dict_patient_identifiers, start_date, end_date)

Generate patient notes embeddings between two dates.

Parameters:

  • df_notes – Pandas Dataframe from notes.

  • df_admissions – Pandas Dataframe from admissions.csv.

  • dict_patient_identifiers – Dict of patient identifiers (i.e. subject_id, hadm_id, stay_id).

  • start_date – Beginning date to consider for embeddings generation.

  • end_date – End date to consider for embeddings generation.

Returns:

df_patient_notes_embeddings: Pandas Dataframe of note embeddings for the patient matching dict_patient_identifiers between start date and end date.

data.mimic.create_master_table.get_biobert_embeddings(text)

Function taken from the GitHub repository of the HAIM study. Obtain BioBERT embeddings of text string.

Parameters:

text – Input text (str).

Returns:

embeddings: Final Biobert embeddings with vector dimensionality = (1,768). hidden_embeddings: Last hidden layer in Biobert model with vector dimensionality = (token_size,768).

data.mimic.create_master_table.get_biobert_embeddings_from_event_list(event_list, event_weights)

Function taken from the GitHub repository of the HAIM study. For notes obtain fixed-size BioBERT embeddings.

Parameters:

  • event_list – Timebound ICU patient stay structure filtered by max_time_stamp or min_time_stamp if any.

  • event_weights – Weights for aggregation of features in final embeddings.

Returns:

aggregated_embeddings: BioBERT event features for all events.

data.mimic.create_master_table.get_patient_demographic_embeddings(patient_id, dict_patient_identifiers, df_embeddings, df_admissions)

Return patient demographic embeddings from df_embeddings and admission time.

Parameters:

  • patient_id – hadm_id of the patient.

  • dict_patient_identifiers – Dict of patient identifiers (i.e. subject_id, hadm_id, stay_id).

  • df_embeddings – Pandas Dataframe from cxr_ic_fusion_1103.csv.

  • df_admissions – Pandas Dataframe from admissions.csv.

Returns:

df_demographic_embeddings: Pandas Dataframe containing demographic embeddings of the considered patient.

data.mimic.create_master_table.get_patient_id(dict_patient_identifiers, df_key_ids)

Get patient id from dict of identifiers.

Parameters:

  • dict_patient_identifiers – Dict of patient identifiers (i.e. subject_id, hadm_id, stay_id).

  • df_key_ids – Pandas Dataframe from haim_mimic_key_ids.csv.

Returns:

data.mimic.create_master_table.get_patient_identifiers(haim_id, df_key_ids)

Get patient identifiers (ie. subject_id, hadm_id, stay_id) given haim_id.

Parameters:

  • haim_id – haim_id of the patient we want identifiers.

  • df_key_ids – Pandas Dataframe from haim_mimic_key_ids.csv.

Returns:

Dict of patients identifiers matching haim_id.

data.mimic.create_master_table.get_patient_image_and_notes_embeddings(patient_id, df_embeddings)

Get image and notes embeddings from the embeddings dataframe given a patient_id.

Parameters:

  • patient_id – hadm_id of a patient.

  • df_embeddings – Pandas Dataframe from cxr_ic_fusion_1103.csv.

Returns:

df_image_embeddings: Image and notes embeddings for the patient.

data.mimic.create_master_table.main()

Main function that creates a temporal master table from MIMIC-IV data.

Returns:

data.mimic.create_master_table.split_note_document(text, min_length=15)

Function taken from the GitHub repository of the HAIM study. Split a text if too long for embeddings generation.

Parameters:

  • text – String of text to be processed into an embedding. BioBERT can only process a string with â‰¤ 512 tokens . If the input text exceeds this token count, we split it based on line breaks (driven from the discharge summary syntax).

  • min_length – When parsing the text into its subsections, remove text strings below a minimum length. These are generally very short and encode minimal information (e.g. ‘Name: ___’).

Returns:

chunk_parse: A list of “chunks”, i.e. text strings, that breaks up the original text into strings with 512 tokens. chunk_length: A list of the token counts for each “chunk”.
